title: The city of Delft in colour in the 1920's

sources.title: The city of Delft in colour in the 1920's
sources.description: Extremely interesting old film footage about the city of Delft in the Netherlands, about a century ago. This film is a collection of many old film fragments. It has been restored, enhanced and colorized by means of state-of-the-art Artificial Intelligence software. Delft is one of the oldest cities in The Netherlands and lies between Rotterdam and The Hague. Many members of the Dutch royal family are buried in the Nieuwe Kerk. There is also a shrine for the famous William of Orange in that church which is said to hold a wooden box with his preserved heart. Delft is also known for its "Delfts Blauw" (Delfts Blue) pottery (porcelain) which is very popular with tourists. It comes in all shapes and sized like the famous vases that can hold a dozen of tulips, each stuck in separate holes. Timeline (thanks to Marco V.A): 00:06 Tramspoor Oude Delft, achter Oude Kerk 00:35 Bagijnhofpoort 00:42 Oostpoort, buitenkant 00:58 Oostpoort, stadskant 01:30 Zicht van Oostpoort naar Nieuwe Kerk 01:50 Binnenwatersloot richting Oude Delft 02:05 Oude Delft 02:25 Vrouwenregt, achterkant Nieuwe Kerk 02:40 Achterkant Oude Jan op de Oude Delft 02:45 Verwersdijk, Choorstraat 03:30 Oude Delft, achter Oude Kerk (zelfde plek als 2.40) 03:50 Hippolytusbuurt, Visbanken 04:40 Bonte Ossteeg, Markt gezien vanaf Voldersgracht 04:45 Oude Delft, voetgangersbrug vanaf Bagijnhofpoort 04:50 Voldersgracht 05:15 Standbeeld Hugo Grotius met Nieuwe Kerk 05:20 Rapenburg, Leiden 05:30 Markt met parade 07:10 Brand Oude Kerk 08:55 Nieuwe kerk vanaf Oude kerk 09:30 Oude Delft, Heilige Geest Kerkhof brug 10:55 Boottocht vanuit Leiden
